item.title: Gretchen add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "It is never too late to be what you might have been." -- George Eliot

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by Daphne Kalotay
item.description: "...she immediately became the person they believed her to be: a peculiar, impatient girl, attractive enough yet too old and odd for the village boys who had once been her friends." -- Daphne Kalotay

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "A man could be a lover and defender of the wilderness without ever in his lifetime leaving the boundaries of asphalt, powerlines, and right-angled surfaces. We need wilderness whether or not we ever set foot in it. We need a refuge even though we may never need to set foot in it. We need the possibility of escape as surely as we need hope; without it the life of the cities would drive all men into crime or drugs or psychoanalysis." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by Margaret Thatcher
item.description: "In politics, If you want anything said, ask a man. If you want anything done, ask a woman." -- Margaret Thatcher

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by Margaret Thatcher
item.description: "Being powerful is like being a lady. If you have to tell people you are, you aren't." -- Margaret Thatcher

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by Margaret Thatcher
item.description: "I always cheer up immensely if an attack is particularly wounding because I think, well, if they attack one personally, it means they have not a single political argument left." -- Margaret Thatcher

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by Margaret Thatcher
item.description: "Do you know that one of the great problems of our age is that we are governed by people who care more about feelings than they do about thoughts and ideas." -- Margaret Thatcher

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by Margaret Thatcher
item.description: "It used to be about trying to do something. Now it's about trying to be someone." -- Margaret Thatcher

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by Margaret Thatcher
item.description: "I think we've been through a period where too many people have been given to understand that if they have a problem, it's the government's job to cope with it. 'I have a problem, I'll get a grant.' 'I'm homeless, the government must house me.' They're casting their problem on society. And, you know, there is no such thing as society. There are individual men and women, and there are families. And no government can do anything except through people, and people must look to themselves first. It's our duty to look after ourselves and then, also to look after our neighbour. People have got the entitlements too much in mind, without the obligations. There's no such thing as entitlement, unless someone has first met an obligation." -- Margaret Thatcher

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by Margaret Thatcher
item.description: "Being democratic is not enough, a majority cannot turn what is wrong into right. In order to be considered truly free, countries must also have a deep love of liberty and an abiding respect for the rule of law." -- Margaret Thatcher

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Then the Grinch thought of something he hadn't before! What if Christmas, he thought, doesn't come from a store. What if Christmas...perhaps...means a little bit more!" -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Gretchen add a quote by Abigail Adams
item.description: "If particular care and attention is not paid to the ladies, we are determined to foment a rebellion, and will not hold ourselves bound by any laws in which we have no voice or representation." -- Abigail Adams
